summary: Eugene Milligan is identified as the Chief of CCS/GLOBE. A memo from Milligan to the Office of the General Counsel on February 5, 1969, addresses questions regarding Thomas Lee Roberts' relationship with Herbert Itkin and the Conestoga Group. The memo clarifies when LPGLOBE became aware of their proposal to Roberts. The documents suggest Milligan's involvement in addressing questions and providing clarification related to the Itkin case and the connections of individuals involved.
significance: Eugene Milligan's significance in the JFK context, based on these documents, lies in his role as Chief of CCS/GLOBE and his involvement in addressing questions and clarifying information related to the Herbert Itkin case, which involved individuals with connections to the CIA and FBI. The documents suggest he was involved in managing and understanding the relationships between various individuals and organizations relevant to the investigation.
